content: There is no information provided in the prev_chunk to assist with summarizing the curr_chunk. The Social Security Act is amended to allow the use of telehealth for monthly end-stage renal disease-related visits. The Social Security Act is amended to allow individuals with end-stage renal disease receiving home dialysis to opt for monthly telehealth visits starting January 1, 2019. This includes a requirement for face-to-face visits initially and every three months thereafter. The Social Security Act is amended to include renal dialysis facilities and the home for monthly end-stage renal disease-related telehealth visits. The Social Security Act is amended to exempt home dialysis monthly telehealth visits from geographic requirements starting January 1, 2019. Additionally, no facility fee is required if the home serves as the originating site for home dialysis therapy. The Social Security Act is amended to clarify telehealth provisions for beneficiaries, including exempting facility fees for home dialysis therapy originating from the home. Section 1128A(i)(6) of the Social Security Act is amended to include telehealth provision for individuals with end stage renal disease under Medicare starting January 1, 2019. Additionally, a study will be conducted to assess the benefits and drawbacks of expanding Medicare coverage for renal dialysis services. The Social Security Act is amended to include coverage of renal dialysis services via telehealth and other technologies. A report on the study results must be submitted to Congress within two years.
